channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for VT
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for VT

item.title: Report X-2023120170
item.description:
Report X-2023120170

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-18T21:10:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-30
  • City: SOUTH BURLINGTON
  • State: VT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: A package handler touched a HazMat and noticed it was wet, he immediately notified the Line Manage who called QA to the scene. The E-Stop was engaged, and the HazMat was pulled off safely and placed into a HazMat bin. Both Manager and Package handler were instructed by QA to wash their hands thoroughly with soap and warm water. DescribePack: The safety cap seemed to be popped off from one of the bottles, which caused it to start leaking as it wasn't properly secured anymore. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: E-stop engaged, Used proper equipment, Contained in Hazmat bin and brought to HazMat processing area by QA.

item.title: Report E-2023120190
item.description:
Report E-2023120190

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-15T21:09:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-09
  • City: WESTMINSTER
  • State: VT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported a spill in Westminister VT, that due to improper loading a 1 G metal can of Certi-Vex AC 1315 super seal (UN1263) was punctured by a pallet releasing 1 Oz of material into the trailer floor. The SDS was reviewed with the terminal and was cleaned and containerized using the PPE available onsite. (1) 20G DM - Absorbents / damaged can was created as waste and left onsite for the terminal to manage.
